ui

Interface UI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Graphical, Textual

    public interface UI
    UI
    Methods that a UI must provide to work with the game characteristics.
    See Also:
    Game

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void looser()
      Remove the looser and exhibit the looser message for him.
      void paint()
      Shows Map.
      void printMap()
      Paint 1 frame of the game.
      void printMiniMap()
      Shows Mini Map.
      void printText(java.lang.Object... strings)
      Send a message to this GUI.
      void sayText(java.lang.Object... strings)
      Send a message to this GUI (with \n).
      void winner(int nTS, int nPlayers, int nRobots)
      Finishes the game.

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        void paint()
        Shows Map.
        Creates a Map with more details of each element of the scenarios and items in the map. Each hexagon represents one title.

      • printMap

        void printMap()
        Paint 1 frame of the game.
        Depending on the speedy attribute, from interface Game, exhibits a frame in the program's standart output.

      • printMiniMap

        void printMiniMap()
        Shows Mini Map.
        Creates a Mini Map with dimensions MAP_SIZE x MAP_SIZE, with a one-character representation of each scenario/item in the map.

      • printText

        void printText(java.lang.Object... strings)
        Send a message to this GUI.
        Prints the message in the appropriate area, with this string.
        Parameters:
        strings - Variable size list of objects, which will have their 'toString()' method used for being printed.

      • sayText

        void sayText(java.lang.Object... strings)
        Send a message to this GUI (with \n).
        Prints the message in the appropriate area, with this string.
        Parameters:
        strings - Variable size list of objects, which will have their 'toString()' method used for being printed.

      • winner

        void winner(int nTS,
          int nPlayers,
          int nRobots)
        Finishes the game.
        Parameters:
        nTS - Number of time steps since the beggining of the game
        nPlayers - Number of players
        nRobots - Number of robots created by all players along the game

      • looser

        void looser()
        Remove the looser and exhibit the looser message for him.
